result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen Marie Dipalma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Karen Marie Dipalma is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Karen Marie Dipalma was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:08 am - DA calls cases 16CM116, 17CM76 amd17CM77 and states appearances.  Defendant Karen Marie Dipalma appeared with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states that DE was on a deferred agreement and this is a motion to enter JOC.    Court finds DE guilty on Ct 1 of 16CM116.  Court dismisses but reads in 17CM76 and 17CM77 for purposes of collecting service fees and blood draw costs.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 Court costs
$200 DNAAS
$130 SBDA
$131 blood draw cost to PRSO.

Appeal rights given

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2017 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Karen Marie Dipalma   PER BOND in 17CM76
Current: N1171 County Road C, Ogema, WI 54459 United States  (Effective: 10-10-2017)
Prior: N1169 County Road C, Ogema, WI 54459

Cases 17CM76 and 17CM77.  Defendant Karen Marie Dipalma appeared with attorney Jessica Schuster.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Atty Schuster states that these two cases along with 16CM116 will get tracked and pre trialed together.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  One bond for both cases.

11:25 am - DA calls cases 16CM106, 16CM107 and 16CM116 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Karen Marie Dipalma appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 16CM106 and Ct 1 in 16CM116.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 16CM106, and defers entry of JOC on Ct 1 of 16CM116, and on motion of DA, dismisses Ct 2 on 16CM116, and dismisses but reads in 16CM107 for purposes of collecting service fees and blood draw cost.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CM106  Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$200 DNAAS
$130 SBDA
$65.50 blood draw cost to County
DE must maintain absolute sobriety.

16CM116  Deferred order for 1 year
See written order. DA to redraft to include $100 DOMAB

Appeal rights given
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Karen Marie Dipalma appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
State's - & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE shall not consume any alcohol.  Defendant may not have contact with George Beaumont, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

10:34 am - Defendant Karen Marie Dipalma appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 12/13/16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
